timeline.author: jamesagnew

replies.bodyText:
Ok, done ...
I revised the code to use SLF4J Logger.info() instead of System.err.println(), and also modified the code to run the test assertions before executing the potentially brittle log output code.
Additionally, in pom.xml I added a test-scoped logback-classic dependency, because SLF4J was defaulting to a NOP logger implementation without it (see also http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#StaticLoggerBinder).
replies.author: jschneid-nmdp

timeline.message: use SLF4J Logger.info() instead of System.err.println(), and run the test assertions first

Add logback-classic dependency to test scope, to enable SLF4J logging within unit tests.  (SLF4J defaults to NOP binding if no binding found on classpath, see also http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#StaticLoggerBinder)
